today_in_history_posts.title: BIP proposal - Dandelion: Privacy Preserving Transaction Propagation
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- A group of developers introduced a privacy-enhancing modification to Bitcoin, named Dandelion.
- Dandelion aims to obscure the original source IP of Bitcoin transactions through a two-phase process.
- The proposal includes a "Mempool Embargo" for added defense and seeks feedback on implementation details.

today_in_history_posts.title: BOLT 11, real time micro payments, and route redundancy
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Andy Schroder inquires about a missing refund address option in BOLT 11, unlike BIP 70.
- He discusses adapting a fuel pump for Lightning with a need for refund address due to pre-payment.
- Questions the feasibility of real-time micropayments for automobiles, considering latency and bandwidth.

today_in_history_posts.title: Thoughts on scaling and consensus changes (2023)
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin's scalability involves establishing 50,000 off-chain entities to handle transactions.
- Innovative solutions like coinpools and sidechain tokens address high transaction costs and centralization concerns.
- Networking off-chain entities with tools for regulatory compliance and safe operation is crucial for scalability.
